column4: i just installed ubuntu 5.10 and the network isn't working. when i do a lspci i see the nic listed but no where else ... advice?
go to System, Administration, Networking, select eth0 and click activate
it doesn't show up there
first go into the Ethernet connections properties and click enable this connection
it doesn't say Ethernet connection?
no, only the modem connection is showing up
actually, it might not be supported ... it's a wireless card and i'm not seeing the chipset at http://linux-wless.passys.nl/
i have a wired card that was showing up like you described, let me put that in =)
Alright! sounds good
did that work?
is it supposed to connect to the internet? or is it working fine?
it wasn't connecting. ...  i just rebooted, out of old habit =\
still no luck
but "The interface eth0 is active"
try pinging your router
i've got a belkin, at 182.168.2.1 ... it give "connect: Network is unreachable"
type ifconfig in a terminal
what am i looking for
where it says eth0, then inet addr: type what it says there
what happend?
i was using mac filtering on my router ... i thought it applied only to wireless connections but aparently it applies to wired connections as well
oh =p
yeah =) afk while i see what i can break next!
